titles.title: Derivatives Trading Integrity Act of 2008
A bill to amend the Commodity Exchange Act to ensure that all agreements, contracts, and transactions with respect to commodities are carried out on a regulated exchange, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S10747)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

bill.summary:
11/20/2008--Introduced.
Derivatives Trading Integrity Act of 2008 - Amends the Commodity Exchange Act to: (1) repeal the exemption or exclusion from regulation by the Commodities Future Trading Commission (CFTC) of specified derivative transactions, swap transactions, and related electronic trading facilities; (2) restrict futures trading to contract markets or derivatives transaction execution facilities; and (3) abolish exempt boards of trade.
